intro: Gethyllis britteniana subsp. herrei, commonly known as the Cape gold dot, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, golden-yellow flowers with distinctive red markings, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
